### m&#95;c&#95;GFCmp() {#a9dffb5012cf082df3b2b6a84c0db7e18}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Pred, typename LHS, typename RHS&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>CompareOp&#95;match&lt; Pred, LHS, RHS, TargetOpcode::G&#95;FCMP, true &gt; llvm::MIPatternMatch::m&#95;c&#95;GFCmp (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> Pred &amp; P, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a> &amp; L, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a> &amp; R)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
G&#95;FCMP matcher that also matches commuted compares.

E.g.

m&#95;c&#95;GFCmp(m&#95;Pred(...), m&#95;FAdd(...), m&#95;GFMul(...))

Could match both of:

fcmp ogt (fadd x, y) (fmul a, b) fcmp olt (fmul a, b) (fadd x, y)

  prototype={<>CompareOp&#95;match&lt; Pred, LHS, RHS, TargetOpcode::G&#95;ICMP, true &gt; llvm::MIPatternMatch::m&#95;c&#95;GICmp (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> Pred &amp; P, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a> &amp; L, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a> &amp; R)</>}

G&#95;ICMP matcher that also matches commuted compares.

E.g.

m&#95;c&#95;GICmp(m&#95;Pred(...), m&#95;GAdd(...), m&#95;GSub(...))

Could match both of:

icmp ugt (add x, y) (sub a, b) icmp ult (sub a, b) (add x, y)

### m&#95;DeferredReg() {#a809eac8eaab0d6c672e05a93fa04a834}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>deferred&#95;ty&lt; Register &gt; llvm::MIPatternMatch::m&#95;DeferredReg (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &amp; R)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Similar to m&#95;SpecificReg/Type, but the specific value to match originated from an earlier sub-pattern in the same mi&#95;match expression.

For example, we cannot match <code>(add X, X)</code> with <code>m&#95;GAdd(m&#95;Reg(X), m&#95;SpecificReg(X))</code> because <code>X</code> is not initialized at the time it&#39;s passed to <code>m&#95;SpecificReg</code>. Instead, we can use <code>m&#95;GAdd(m&#95;Reg(x), m&#95;DeferredReg(X))</code>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/mipatternmatch-h/#l00402">402</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/mipatternmatch-h">MIPatternMatch.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
